questions.question_text_1: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "DEGREE LEVEL : DESIGN THINKING FOR DATA-DRIVEN APP DEVELOPMENT (COMPUTER BASED EXAM)" ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN. (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT, PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)
question_texts: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "DEGREE LEVEL : DESIGN THINKING FOR DATA-DRIVEN APP DEVELOPMENT (COMPUTER BASED EXAM)" ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN. (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT, PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)

questions.question_text_1:
General Instructions: 
(i) The question paper has multiple-choice questions (MCQs) that must be answered on the computer. Answer all the questions. 
(ii) The questions numbered 3 to 27 carry one mark each. Read the instructions carefully and choose the closest and correct option; there is only one right answer for each question. 
(iii) The questions numbered 28 to 32 are case study-based multiple-choice questions of two marks each. Read the instructions carefully and choose the closest and correct option; there is only one right answer for each question. 
(iv) All characters, relationships and events depicted in the questions or cases are fictitious. Any similarity to actual events or persons, living or dead, is coincidental.
question_texts:
General Instructions: 
(i) The question paper has multiple-choice questions (MCQs) that must be answered on the computer. Answer all the questions. 
(ii) The questions numbered 3 to 27 carry one mark each. Read the instructions carefully and choose the closest and correct option; there is only one right answer for each question. 
(iii) The questions numbered 28 to 32 are case study-based multiple-choice questions of two marks each. Read the instructions carefully and choose the closest and correct option; there is only one right answer for each question. 
(iv) All characters, relationships and events depicted in the questions or cases are fictitious. Any similarity to actual events or persons, living or dead, is coincidental.

options.option_text: This Instructions is just for a reference & not for an evaluation.

questions.question_text_1: How does the concept of empathy in Karmic Design Thinking relate to the teachings of Lord Buddha?
question_texts: How does the concept of empathy in Karmic Design Thinking relate to the teachings of Lord Buddha?

options.option_text: By comparing it to finding the cause of suffering
By emphasizing the importance of understanding others' feelings
By linking it to the cessation of suffering
By associating it with following the Noble Fourfold Path

questions.question_text_1: In the Four Noble Truths, Samudaya is to find out the reason for suffering. In the Karmic Design Thinking context, what is it?
question_texts: In the Four Noble Truths, Samudaya is to find out the reason for suffering. In the Karmic Design Thinking context, what is it?

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following statements is NOT a characteristic of a project?
question_texts: Which of the following statements is NOT a characteristic of a project?

options.option_text: A project has a defined beginning and end, focusing on achieving specificobjectives within a certain timeframe.
A project is unique in nature, involving tasks and activities that differ fromroutine operations and produce a distinct outcome.
A project requires a unique set of resources and team members whocollaborate to achieve a specific goal.
A project is designed to be a repetitive, ongoing effort with regularly repeatedprocesses.

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following best describes a key tenet of effective Agile development?
question_texts: Which of the following best describes a key tenet of effective Agile development?

options.option_text: Agile development emphasizes comprehensive upfront planning to minimizethe need for changes during the development process, focusing on a single defined outcome.
Effective Agile development involves gathering frequent feedback from end-users to iteratively refine the product and work towards the desired outcomes.
Agile development requires detailed documentation of all features andspecifications before any iteration, aiming to avoid unexpected changes or feedback.
Effective Agile development primarily aims to complete all phases of theproject lifecycle sequentially ensuring minimal disruptions.

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following are methods used in the Empathize/ first phase of any Design Thinking methodology? 1. Interviews and Conversations 2. Observations 3. Shadowing 4. Role-playing 5. Fly-on-the-wall research Select the correct option using the codes given below:
question_texts: Which of the following are methods used in the Empathize/ first phase of any Design Thinking methodology? 1. Interviews and Conversations 2. Observations 3. Shadowing 4. Role-playing 5. Fly-on-the-wall research Select the correct option using the codes given below:

questions.question_text_1: In Karmic Design Thinking, what are the important phases that one needs to analyze while creating a customer journey mapping? 1. Before 2. Awareness 3. Consideration 4. Decision 5. During 6. Delivery 7. After Select the correct option using the codes given below:
question_texts: In Karmic Design Thinking, what are the important phases that one needs to analyze while creating a customer journey mapping? 1. Before 2. Awareness 3. Consideration 4. Decision 5. During 6. Delivery 7. After Select the correct option using the codes given below:

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following descriptors contains elements of an effective persona?
question_texts: Which of the following descriptors contains elements of an effective persona?

options.option_text: Tony Stark, a 53-year-old genius, billionaire, and philanthropist.
Ethan Hunt, a highly skilled and resourceful secret agent who takes updangerous missions.

Kabir Khan, a 40-year-old male, hailing from a small town near Delhi, formerhockey player, ex-captain of the Indian national team, known for his fierce dedication and determination to redeem himself as a coach.
Jordan, a passionate musician, whose heartbreak fuels his rise to fame,leading him down a path of self-destruction and loneliness.

questions.question_text_1: Customer journey maps help teams: 1. Step into a customer’s shoes and understand their perspective 2. Gain empathy to understand customer needs, perceptions, and overall experience 3. Identify problems and roadblocks that a customer may experience 4. Align with other team members and stakeholders to solve cross-functional problems Select the correct option using the codes given below:
question_texts: Customer journey maps help teams: 1. Step into a customer’s shoes and understand their perspective 2. Gain empathy to understand customer needs, perceptions, and overall experience 3. Identify problems and roadblocks that a customer may experience 4. Align with other team members and stakeholders to solve cross-functional problems Select the correct option using the codes given below:

questions.question_text_1: State whether the following statement is true or false: "If you already have a product or service in the market, creating a customer journey map is not essential, to pinpoint moments of frustration, confusion, or churn, during design thinking exercise."
question_texts: State whether the following statement is true or false: "If you already have a product or service in the market, creating a customer journey map is not essential, to pinpoint moments of frustration, confusion, or churn, during design thinking exercise."

questions.question_text_1: Consider the following statements about Design Research and select the correct answer: Statement 1: Design Research is about extracting insights about the user that goes beyond the designer's or developer's intuition. Statement 2: Design Research is about gathering a small number of solid insights from a large number of target users.
question_texts: Consider the following statements about Design Research and select the correct answer: Statement 1: Design Research is about extracting insights about the user that goes beyond the designer's or developer's intuition. Statement 2: Design Research is about gathering a small number of solid insights from a large number of target users.

options.option_text: Statement 1 is incorrect, Statement 2 is correct.
Statement 1 is correct, Statement 2 is correct.
Statement 1 is incorrect, Statement 2 is incorrect.
Statement 1 is correct, Statement 2 is incorrect.

questions.question_text_1: According to Don Norman in The Design of Everyday Things, what is essential for achieving good design in the face of ‘competitive pressures’?
question_texts: According to Don Norman in The Design of Everyday Things, what is essential for achieving good design in the face of ‘competitive pressures’?

options.option_text: Adding features that appeal to multiple market segments
Ensuring the product is aesthetically appealing to stand out
Stepping back from competitive pressures to create a coherent andunderstandable product
Prioritizing rapid updates to keep up with competitor products

questions.question_text_1: What insights can be gained from analyzing a persona and a customer journey map? 1. Basic demographic and psychographic details of customers, such as their age, location, preferences, and behaviours. 2. Underlying concerns, values, motivations, and goals of customers, their experiences, emotions, and interactions with a product or service. 3. Understanding what customers care about for creating products and services that resonate with them. Select the correct option using the codes given below:
question_texts: What insights can be gained from analyzing a persona and a customer journey map? 1. Basic demographic and psychographic details of customers, such as their age, location, preferences, and behaviours. 2. Underlying concerns, values, motivations, and goals of customers, their experiences, emotions, and interactions with a product or service. 3. Understanding what customers care about for creating products and services that resonate with them. Select the correct option using the codes given below:

questions.question_text_1: How should we handle steps in the customer journey map that show sad-face emoticons?
question_texts: How should we handle steps in the customer journey map that show sad-face emoticons?

options.option_text: List them as issues to address.
Sort the sad-face steps into categories like angry, frustrated, or fearful.
Remove them to get a clearer view of an ideal, positive customer journey.

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following best describes the purpose of a "How Might We" in the Design Thinking process?
question_texts: Which of the following best describes the purpose of a "How Might We" in the Design Thinking process?

options.option_text: To define a specific solution to a known problem
To generate a broad question that invites creative problem-solving
To summarize the list of problems in a single statement
To identify conflicts of interest before solution generation

questions.question_text_1: When testing a prototype with a group of users, which of the following should you avoid?
question_texts: When testing a prototype with a group of users, which of the following should you avoid?

options.option_text: Asking users to describe their experience
Explaining in detail what the prototype is intended to do
Allowing users to experience the prototype on their own

questions.question_text_1: In Karmic Design Thinking, which of the Four Noble Truths corresponds to the Test phase?
question_texts: In Karmic Design Thinking, which of the Four Noble Truths corresponds to the Test phase?

questions.question_text_1: State whether the following statement is True or False: “Once in the Test stage, it is advisable to revisit the Empathize, Analyze, or Solve stages if necessary.”
question_texts: State whether the following statement is True or False: “Once in the Test stage, it is advisable to revisit the Empathize, Analyze, or Solve stages if necessary.”

questions.question_text_1: State whether the following statement is True or False: “In Multi-Why analysis, it is essential to determine the answer to each ‘Why’ statement before proceeding to the next level of ‘Why’ analysis.”
question_texts: State whether the following statement is True or False: “In Multi-Why analysis, it is essential to determine the answer to each ‘Why’ statement before proceeding to the next level of ‘Why’ analysis.”

questions.question_text_1: In Karmic Design Thinking, when using Multi-Why analysis with real customers or target users, what approach should be taken?
question_texts: In Karmic Design Thinking, when using Multi-Why analysis with real customers or target users, what approach should be taken?

options.option_text: Identify and prioritize key problems from the customer’s perspective to focuson.
Apply the Multi-Why analysis to every problem identified during the Empathizephase, regardless of priority.
Use insights from possible solutions to filter out less relevant issues beforeapplying Multi-Why analysis.
Make assumptions about potential answers to Multi-Why questions to quicklyarrive at a conflict of interest.

questions.question_text_1: After applying Multi-Why analysis to identify the deeper problem, which of the following steps should be taken next? 1. Verify the correctness of your Multi-Why analysis through data or consultation with customers or experts. 2. Select each of the Multi-Why levels and analyze it further using a conflict of interest approach. Select the correct option:
question_texts: After applying Multi-Why analysis to identify the deeper problem, which of the following steps should be taken next? 1. Verify the correctness of your Multi-Why analysis through data or consultation with customers or experts. 2. Select each of the Multi-Why levels and analyze it further using a conflict of interest approach. Select the correct option:

questions.question_text_1: Consider the statements about ‘silent brainstorming’ in Karmic Design Thinking 1. At the beginning of brainstorming, the team should jot down every idea, no matter whether it is good or bad. 2. The team should defer judgment and not critique ideas during the brainstorming session. Which of the above statements is/are correct?
question_texts: Consider the statements about ‘silent brainstorming’ in Karmic Design Thinking 1. At the beginning of brainstorming, the team should jot down every idea, no matter whether it is good or bad. 2. The team should defer judgment and not critique ideas during the brainstorming session. Which of the above statements is/are correct?

questions.question_text_1: How should conflicts of interest be addressed during the Analyze phase in design thinking?
question_texts: How should conflicts of interest be addressed during the Analyze phase in design thinking?

options.option_text: By identifying loopholes in the problem

questions.question_text_1: Which two core concepts form the foundation of TRIZ? 1. Silent brainstorming 2. Innovation algorithm 3. Traditional logic 4. Contradictions 5. Inventive principles Select the correct option using the codes given below:
question_texts: Which two core concepts form the foundation of TRIZ? 1. Silent brainstorming 2. Innovation algorithm 3. Traditional logic 4. Contradictions 5. Inventive principles Select the correct option using the codes given below:

questions.question_text_1: In the Design Thinking process, the Solve phase is characterized by encouraging the generation of a wide range of creative ideas and exploring numerous potential solutions without immediate judgment or evaluation. This approach makes the Solve phase primarily a ________ phase.
question_texts: In the Design Thinking process, the Solve phase is characterized by encouraging the generation of a wide range of creative ideas and exploring numerous potential solutions without immediate judgment or evaluation. This approach makes the Solve phase primarily a ________ phase.

questions.question_text_1: According to Don Norman’s principles on Human Factors in Design, which of the following best describes the role of "affordances" in product design?
question_texts: According to Don Norman’s principles on Human Factors in Design, which of the following best describes the role of "affordances" in product design?

options.option_text: They provide feedback on the results of an action taken by the user.
They suggest possible actions by indicating what functions are available to theuser.
They establish constraints to prevent user errors during interactions.
They enhance the aesthetics of a product to improve user satisfaction.

questions.question_text_1: [Nature’s Glow] Prem is the founder of "Nature’s Glow," a small business specializing in organic skincare products. Although his products are high-quality and environmentally friendly, he has recently observed a drop in customer loyalty and sales. Some customers have expressed concerns about the packaging not being eco-friendly enough, while others have highlighted issues with the website’s user experience. Hoping to rejuvenate his business, Prem decides to hire you, a Design Thinking consultant to help address challenges. Answer the given subquestions based on this scenario:
question_texts: [Nature’s Glow] Prem is the founder of "Nature’s Glow," a small business specializing in organic skincare products. Although his products are high-quality and environmentally friendly, he has recently observed a drop in customer loyalty and sales. Some customers have expressed concerns about the packaging not being eco-friendly enough, while others have highlighted issues with the website’s user experience. Hoping to rejuvenate his business, Prem decides to hire you, a Design Thinking consultant to help address challenges. Answer the given subquestions based on this scenario:

questions.question_text_1: [Nature’s Glow] Prem has received customer feedback about his packaging and website usability through customer ratings and feedback forms. What should be your first step in applying Karmic Design Thinking to address these concerns?
question_texts: [Nature’s Glow] Prem has received customer feedback about his packaging and website usability through customer ratings and feedback forms. What should be your first step in applying Karmic Design Thinking to address these concerns?

options.option_text: Analyze data to find the least popular products
Conduct interviews or surveys with some customers to understand their painpoints
Reach out to suppliers to discuss new packaging options
Redesign the website based on customer feedback and further investigation

questions.question_text_1: [Nature’s Glow] With the insights gathered in the previous step, (in Question No. 29),what is your next step in applying Karmic Design Thinking to address the issues in packaging and website usability?
question_texts: [Nature’s Glow] With the insights gathered in the previous step, (in Question No. 29),what is your next step in applying Karmic Design Thinking to address the issues in packaging and website usability?

options.option_text: List down the problems that customers face with respect to product packagingand website usability.
Prototype a new product packaging and website design
Conduct prototype testing on the current website and packaging
Brainstorm creative solutions to improve packaging and website experience

questions.question_text_1: [Nature’s Glow] You have some ideas to address almost all the pain points identified. What should your next action be in the Karmic Design Thinking process?
question_texts: [Nature’s Glow] You have some ideas to address almost all the pain points identified. What should your next action be in the Karmic Design Thinking process?

options.option_text: Implement the best ideas that are affordable
Seek immediate customer feedback on ideas through surveys
Create prototypes of the new packaging and website design for user testing
Conduct a market survey to gauge competitor strategies
